name: Blurry
tagline: Blurry is an easy blur library for Android
body: [![Android Arsenal](https://img.shields.io/badge/Android%20Arsenal-Blurry-brightgreen.svg?style=flat)](https://android-arsenal.com/details/1/2192) [![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-Apache%202-blue.svg)](https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0) [![Download](https://api.bintray.com/packages/wasabeef/maven/blurry/images/download.svg)](https://bintray.com/wasabeef/maven/blurry/_latestVersion) `Blurry` is an easy blur library for `Android`. ![logo](https://github.com/wasabeef/Blurry/raw/master/art/blurry.png) Screenshot --- ![Demo](https://github.com/wasabeef/Blurry/raw/master/art/blurry.gif) How do I use it? --- ### Setup ##### Gradle ```groovy dependencies { compile 'jp.wasabeef:blurry:x.x.x' } ``` ### Functions **Overlay** Parent must be ViewGroup ```java Blurry.with(context).radius(25).sampling(2).onto(rootView); ``` **Into** ```java Blurry.with(context).capture(view).into(imageView); ``` **Blur Options** - Radius - Down Sampling - Color Filter - Asynchronous Support ```java Blurry.with(context) .radius(10) .sampling(8) .color(Color.argb(66, 255, 255, 0)) .async() .onto(rootView); ``` Requirements -------------- Android 2.3+ Developed By ------- Daichi Furiya (Wasabeef) - License ------- Copyright 2015 Wasabeef Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
